DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD Probex Successfully Closes on Million Financing Probex Corp AMEX PRB Financing to assist in continuing engineering and development work leading up to construction of Wellsville OH reprocessing facility Groundbreaking set for first quarter Probex New patented unparalleled highly economic and environmentally beneficial motor oil reprocessing technology For more information click aaspIDDaa AOL USERS copy paste the link above into your browser DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD TI Insight Electronics Extend Distribution Relationship DALLAS and OAKLAND Calif Dec PRNewswire via COMTEX Texas Instruments Incorporated NYSE TXN TI and Insight Electronics a member of the Memec Group announced today they will expand the distributor relations hip that existed prior to TIs acquisition of Burr Brown Insight has been the leading distributor in the Americas for the TIBurr Brown precision analog products for the past seven years The focus of the new agreement is to give Insight customers that design communications computing audio and video imaging systems greater access t o the most comprehensive selection of high performance analog and mixed signal solutions Insight will also provide billofmaterial support for customers with the full TI product offering including TIs digital signal processing DSP product portfolio Insight has a track record of success supporting customers with Burr Brown products said John Simari worldwide director of distribution Texas Instruments We want to leverage Insights strengths across TI especially TIs analog and mixed signal product portfolio to further our growth in this important area The full TI analog product line will be available in the Americas through Insight by January Product stocking and training is expected to be complete by the end of Q In the interim Insight will continue to represent the TIBurr Brown precision analog products The customer solution focus shared by Insight and TI makes this a perfect fit said Greg Provenzano president and CEO of Insight Electronics This partnership allows uninterrupted support to our TIBurr Brown customers in addition to an enhanced offering of technology products Insight has always been focused on the technical design community and its needs especially in the analog area said Provenzano Coupling our strengths with TIs initiative to grow its position in precision analog provides grea t synergy and will help designers bring advanced systems to market faster and more efficiently About Insight Electronics Insight Electronics is the largest technical distributor of semiconductors in North and South America With divisions in the US Mexico Canada and South America and a focused linecard of leading semiconductor companies Insights sales team and field application engineers are thoroughly knowledgeable about their suppliers products processes and technologies The companys valueadded services combined with its expertise in design inventory management logistics and use of ebusiness tools ensure that customers receive the products they need when and where they need them Web address is wwwinsightelectronicscom About Texas Instruments Texas Instruments Incorporated is the world leader in digital signal processing and analog technologies the semiconductor engines of the Internet age The companys businesses also include sensors and controls and educational and productivity solutions TI is headquartered in Dallas Texas and has manufacturing or sales operations in more than countries Texas Instruments is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TXN More information is located on the World Wide Web at SOURCE Texas Instruments Incorporated Semiconductor REVIEW THE NOTICE AND DISCLAIMER BELOW DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDD Paid Advertisement D DDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD Looking for an emerging growth company in an exciting burgeoning industry Search no more XraymediaCom OTC BB XRMD is currently assembling the partners to undertake the business of selling conventional advertising space and online advertising in an industry that broke the billion dollar mark in the second quarter of For more compelling information on this exciting investment opportunity click here aaspIDDaa AOL USERS copy paste the link above into your browser DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD Broadcom Unveils Worlds First Gigabit Ethernet Controller with Support for PCIX StandardFDBCM Demonstrates Higher Performance and Lower C PU Utilization Than Any Other Commercially Available Solution IRVINE Calif Dec BUSINESS WIRE Broadcom Corporation NasdaqBRCM the leading provider of integrated circuits enabling broadba nd communications today extended its leadership position in Gigabit Ethernet with the introduction of the worlds first Gigabit Ethernet Media Access Control ler MAC chip that supports Peripheral Computer Interconnect PCI and PCIX local bus interfaces for use in network interface cards NIC and LANonMotherbo ard LOM implementations The companys first Gigabit Ethernet MAC the BroadcomR BCM which co mes with a comprehensive suite of software sets a new standard in the industry for performance and onchip integration Broadcoms high performance BASET MAC is complemented by its broad family of Gigabit Ethernet transcei ver chips and will enable the company to provide customers with complete MACtransceiver solutions that will drive down the cost of Gigabit Ethernet in nextgeneration servers workstations and desktop computers Furthermore Broadcoms strategic alliance announced today with Com Corporation the mo st preferred brand and channel for network interface cards and LOM networking solutions will further accelerate customer migration from Fast Ethernet to Gigabit Ethernet By delivering leading edge MAC transceiver and software technology with unprecedented levels of integration Broadcom is driving up performance whi le driving down the price points to enable widespread adoption of Gigabit Ethernet said Marty Colombatto Vice President and General Manager of Broadcoms Networking Business Unit Broadcoms initiative to develop Giga bit MAC technology is strategic to our overall commitment to deliver to our customers the highest level of integration and performance for the advancem ent of corporate networks Broadcoms first generation Gigabit Ethernet controller provides an unprecedented level of integration combining support for Megab it per second Mbps operation dual highspeed onchip processors KB of integrated onchip memory advanced packet classification engines and PCI PCIX local bus interconnects in a singlechip solution Triple speed and Mbps support with standardbased autonegotiation allows server workstation and desktop computer manufacturers to build solutions that can transparently interface with Ethernet Fast Ethernet and Gigabit Ethernet technology over the existing Category cabling infrastructure and provide s an easy path for migrating legacy Mbps and Mbps networks to Gigabit speed The BCM is the industrys first Gigabit MAC to incorporate the recently approved PCIX v local bus interface specification allowing data transfe r rates of up to Gigabytes per second between the controller and the system Support for PCIX enables Broadcoms Gigabit Ethernet MAC to maintain traff ic at Gigabit speeds in IO intensive server applications where multiple communication and storage peripheral devices share the same IO bus Broadcoms support f or the new PCIX interface demonstrates the companys commitment to delivering leading edge IO technology for servers and workstations According to Bert McComas analyst for InQuest Market research By the mid dle of we expect that PCIX will be enabled in new mainstream server platforms from all leading server vendors PCIX builds on the momentum of PCI as the most widely supported IO standard in the world and defines a clear path to satisfy next generation server IO performance demands Gigabit Ethernet provides ten times the performance of todays BASE T server workstation and desktop network connections This leap forward in performance is especially critical for todays servers and workstations tha t are already being bottlenecked by aging Ethernet connections With Inter net traffic doubling every three to six months accelerating the performance an d communication speed of the server is critical for enhancing endusers Internet and eBusiness experience Early tests show the BCM raises the bar for the competition in both throughput and host CPU efficiency By focusing on total performance of the system the architecture of the BCM enables servers and workstations no t only to communicate faster but also to reduce the consumption of valuable system resources needed to reach Gigabit communications speeds PCIX is an extension of the widely accepted PCI standard for data transfer between CPUs and IO peripherals and is becoming widely used by manufacture rs for speeding the flow of data within servers storage area networks and network switches Backwards compatible with the high performance PCI local bus specification PCIX offers an immediate solution to the increased IO requirements for highbandwidth applications such as Gigabit Ethernet Fibr e Channel Ultra SCSI and highperformance graphics PCIX supports bit a nd bit operations at frequencies up to MHz allowing data throughput of over Gigabyte per second Broadcom also offers the most complete suite of software for server applications supporting all leading operating systems This software suite is already undergoing extensive systemlevel qualification by leading server OEMs Broadcoms server software package includes multivendor failover IEEE AD port aggregation Layer switchindependent SmartLoadBalancingTM HotPlug PCI IEEE Q VLAN tagging and IEEE P traffic prioritization for Quality of Service QoS cable analyzer and advanced diagnostics and cont rol functions The combined BCM MAC and server software solution demonstrat es superior functionality to any other Gigabit Ethernet NIC or LOM solution commercially available today A complete NIC and LOM solution is achieved by combining the BCM with o ne of Broadcoms market leading Gigabit Ethernet transceivers which support the three Ethernet speeds and Mbps in a singlechip solution with intelligent networking functions such as cable diagnostics and auto networ k detection Having shipped over a million Gigabit Ethernet ports Broadcom continues to extend its leadership position in Gigabit Ethernet with the broadest most advanced family of Gigabit Ethernet transceivers Broadcoms Gigabit Ethernet transceiver architecture is the only solution that has bee n proven in actual highvolume field deployment Furthermore Broadcoms Giga bit Ethernet transceiver architecture has completed over eighteen months of extensive system and devicelevel testing in realworld and worsecase cable plants by hundreds of engineers in dozens of test sites worldwide Pricing and Availability Broadcoms Gigabit Ethernet MAC and Phy chipset solution is available now a nd is priced at About Broadcom Broadcom Corporation is the leading provider of highly integrated silicon solutions that enable broadband digital transmission of voice video and data Using proprietary technologies and advanced design methodologies the compa ny designs develops and supplies integrated circuits for a number of the most significant broadband communications markets including the markets for cab le settop boxes cable modems highspeed local metropolitan and wide area networks home networking Voice over Internet Protocol VoIP carrier access residential broadband gateways direct broadcast satellite and terrestrial digital broadcast optical networking digital subscriber lines xDSL and wireless communications Broadcom is headquartered in Irvine Calif and m ay be contacted at or at wwwbroadcomcom Safe Harbor Statement under the premie r provider of fullypersonalized dynamicallygenerated daily horoscopes and other multimedia astrology content and applications today announced an integrate d content distribution agreement with Yahoo Inc Nasdaq YHOO a leading global Internet communications commerce and media company The agreement calls fo r AstrologyIScom to be integrated into YahooR Astrology and Yahoo Greetings as well as a featured store on Yahoo Shopping On Yahoo Astrology AstrologyIScom is providing comprehensive astrologica l forecasting information where Yahoo consumers will be able to access oneofakind daily from Dollar Signs An Astrological Guide to Personal Finance by Wall Street veteran and AstrologyIScom PresidentCEO Yvonne Morabito In addition people can also access colorful animated astrological E Card s through Yahoo Greetings and weekly ShopScopes and numerous personalized books and other astrologyrelated products in the Astrostore a featured store on Yahoo Shopping Our multiproperty relationship with Yahoo provides an excellent opportun ity to deliver our unique topquality astrological content and products to Yahoos vast global audience through a number of properties says director of production media and entertainment Yahoo The breadth of this content further enables us to provide consumers a fully integrated and comprehensive experience whether t hey are on Yahoo paste the link above into your browser DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD QUALCOMM Announces ICC Arbitration Decision Regarding Royalty Dispute with ETRI SAN DIEGO Dec BUSINESS WIRE QUALCOMM Incorporated NasdaqQC OM today announced that the International Court of Arbitration ICA of the International Chamber of Commerce ICC has issued its decision and award arising from the arbitration between QUALCOMM and the Korean Electronics an d Telecommunications Research Institute ETRI As a result of the award by the ICC QUALCOMM will report in its first fis cal quarter of ending in December a onetime charge of approximately million for additional royalties to be shared with ETRI as well as interest and other costs for the period from inception of the Joint Development Agreemen t between the parties in to September In addition the ICA ordered that QUALCOMM continue to share with ETRI a part of the royalties that QUALCOMM receives only on sales of certain Code Division Multiple Access CDMA equipment for use in Korea The continuing payments ordered in the ICA decision are expected to have little impact on the order of million per quarter depending on the sales of phones and infrastructure in Korea on the revenues and earnings of QUALCOMM in future quarters While we are disappointed by the ICAs decision we continue to look forwa rd to receiving strong royalty revenues from sales of CDMA equipment in Korea s aid Louis M Lupin senior vice president and general counsel of QUALCOMM The ICAs decision does not in any way affect QUALCOMMs ability to collect royalties on CDMA WCDMA or other CDMAbased standards and has no impact o n the ability of QUALCOMM to collect royalties from sales of CDMA equipment in Korea The Company is evaluating its options with respect to the award QUALCOMM Incorporated wwwqualcommcom is a leader in developing and delivering innovative digital wireless communications products and services based on the Companys CDMA digital technology The Companys business area s include integrated CDMA chipsets and system software technology licensing EudoraR email software for WindowsR and MacintoshR computing platform s digital cinema systems and satellitebased systems including portions of t he GlobalstarTM system and wireless fleet management systems OmniTRACSR a nd OmniExpressTM QUALCOMM owns patents that are essential to all of the CDM A wireless telecommunications standards that have been adopted or proposed fo r adoption by standardssetting bodies worldwide QUALCOMM has licensed its essential CDMA patent portfolio to more than telecommunications equipmen t manufacturers worldwide Headquartered in San Diego Calif QUALCOMM is included in the SP Index and is a FORTUNE R company traded o n The Nasdaq Stock MarketR under the ticker symbol QCOM Except for the historical information contained herein this news release contains forwardlooking statements that are subject to risks and uncertainties including the Companys ability to successfully design and have manufacture d significant quantities of CDMA components on a timely and profitable basis the extent and speed to which CDMA is deployed change in economic conditions o f the various markets the Company serves as well as the other risks detailed fro m time to time in the Companys SEC reports including the report on Form K for the year ended September and most recent Form Q QUALCOMM OmniTRACS and Eudora are registered trademarks and OmniExpress is a trademark of QUALCOMM Incorporated Globalstar is a trademark of Loral paste the link above into your browser DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD AMCC First to Enable the Next Generation MultiCarrier Transparent Network Architecture With Introduction of Gbps Digital Wrapper and FEC DeviceFDAMCCs Hudson is the Industrys First Device to Meet the Rapidl y Growing Demand for Gbps Digital Wrapper Solutions From the Man Transport and WD M Sectors SAN DIEGO Dec BUSINESS WIRE Applied Micro Circuits Corp AM CC NasdaqAMCC a leader in highbandwidth silicon connectivity solutions fo r the worlds optical networks today announced the Hudson S the industry s first Gbps silicon device architected to support both the evolving G digital wrapper standard and traditional SONETSDH infrastructures The Hudson variable rate digital wrapper framerdeframer and performance monitor device facilitates the transparent transport of multiple protocols across the network while aiding interconnection between multiple carriers Hudson incorporates programmable Forward Error Correction FEC for rates u p to Gbps and supports OC transmission standards The digital wrapper technology provides an extension of the current SONETSDH infrastructure while enhancing both flexibility and transparency across the network The Hudson easily interfaces with AMCCs Gbps muxdemux devices SONETSDHdigital wrapper backplane devices and AMCCs mapping and pointer processing devices The digital wrapper is the next important step for large optical networks as it incorporates the best features of SONETSDH while removing some of the rigi d overhead structure that makes SONETSDH suboptimal for an IPcentric intelligent optical network said Brent Little vice president of marketin g for AMCC By using key devices such as Hudson OEMs will now be able to create more efficient and interoperable systems without starting from scratch AMCCs digital wrapper design has already been adopted by most of the major wide area networking WAN equipment manufacturers The demand for digital wrapp er products stems from the need in the WAN to transparently transport multiple protocols at Gbps coupled with the need to efficiently provision bandwi dth across todays multiplecarrier network The Hudson is built for the nextgeneration multicarrier transport networ k architecture and ushers in an efficient and costeffective means of transporting traffic while extending existing SONET infrastructures said Ken Prentiss AMCCs director of marketing for telecom products We are seeing unprecedented demand for Hudson across a large customer base due mainly to the devices flexible architecture customers can wrap unwrap or monitor traditional SONETSDH traffic or wrap and unwrap IP or any other traffic using a singl e device The digital wrapper concept involves grouping together a number of existing frames into superframes which can then be more efficiently managed with a relatively small allocation of overheadperbyte of data By aggregating together the provisions for framing bits that are already defined for use by existing timedivision multiplexed TDM structures the superframe concep t allows for the implementation of an intelligent operation administration a nd maintenance OAM capability without materially expanding the amount of dat a currently being transmitted This creative use of available control bits al so allows FEC functions to be very efficiently incorporated within the digital wrapper definition without a significant net increase in overall bandwidth usage The Hudsons core logic runs on a V power supply and features two input and two output ports which are configurable in many ways Figure shows a typical network application supporting a single data stream with dual redundant inp ut and output lines The input and output ports can be configured as a dual redundant IO on a single data stream for protection switching or as two completely independent data streams for duplex operation Either input port can be directly connected to either output port for loopback testing The Hudson provides full digital wrapper performance monitoring and feature s Optical Channel Overhead OChOH insertion and extraction which are independently controllable All OChOH bytes in a superframe are programmable in function and are available for insertion from and drop to FPGA or microprocessor Data entering and leaving the Hudson device can be optional ly differentially decoded and encoded deframed and framed descrambled and scrambled and decoded and encoded with FEC information In addition SONET data can optionally be performance monitored for integrity alarms and trace messages Pricing and Availability The Hudson S packaged in a pin CBGA will be sampling to development partners in December with volume production commencing in Q AMCC solution set pricing can be obtained from the company by calling AMCC About AMCC AMCC designs develops manufactures and markets highperformance highbandwidth silicon solutions for the worlds optical networks AMCC utilizes a combination of highfrequency analog mixedsignal and digital design expertise coupled with systemlevel knowledge and multiple silicon process technologies to offer integrated circuit products that enable the transport of voice and data over fiber optic networks The companys system solution portfolio includes PMD PHY framermapper network processor traffic management and switch fabric devices that address the highperformance need s of the evolving intelligent optical network AMCCs corporate headquarters and wafer fabrication facilities are located in San Diego Sales and engineerin g offices are located throughout the world AMCC Forward Looking Statements The statements contained in this press release that are not purely historic al are Supp ort Move to Standardsbased Deployment Models RICHARDSON Texas Dec BUSINESS WIRE OpenVoBtm today announ ced that prominent telecommunications technology leaders have signed on as memb ers of OpenVoB effectively doubling membership of the open industry engineerin g organization formed to accelerate the deployment of interoperable voice ove r broadband technologies products and services The new members of OpenVoB join the ongoing efforts of a broadbased group of leading telecom cable and wireless broadband network developers to elimina te obstacles standing in the way of validated VoB solutions The organization is working to ensure uninhibited growth in the deployment of voice over broadb and networks through the cooperative development of proven multivendor architectural options and interoperable platforms for implementing industry standard VoB technologies The first of these implementations and test plan models the D GRA AL BLES model for VoDSL systems based on the ATM Forum AAL Loop Emulation Service was tested at the groups inaugural OpenVoB CallFesttm held the week o f Nov Dec at the University of New Hampshire InterOperability Laboratory in Durham NH This first CallFest was a controlled working engineeronly event structured to create a secure cooperative test environment in which senior product development and test engineers are free to address critical interoperability issues between products and platforms being readi ed for deployment About OpenVoB OpenVoB was formed to meet the expressed needs of service providers plannin g to deploy voice over broadband services OpenVoB is committed to developing deployment models for voice over broadband utilizing established and emergi ng guidelines supported by the worlds leading industry standards bodies The special interest group is not seeking to develop new standards or modify existing standards nor does it promote the specific technologies products or services of any individual company or vendorspecific alliance All vendors customers industry associations and others partners and competitors alik e seeking to contribute to the acceleration of voice over broadband are encouraged to join OpenVoB and participate fully in all activities Members of OpenVoB have drafted a white paper that outlines the pressing ne ed for this organization and presents a road map detailing the steps the group intends to take to reach its primary objectives The white paper can be fou nd on the OpenVoB Web site which also hosts a wealth of information about the OpenVoB organization FAQs online technical discussi on groups and other resources For more information about becoming a member o f OpenVoB please contact New Members of OpenVoB AtlanticTelecom Atlantic Telecom is a panEuropean competitive local exchange carrier CLEC which provides voice and data services to small to medium sized enterprises and high end residential customers Atlantics wide portfolio of services resul ts from its growing broadband infrastructure which includes an existing ATMba sed backbone network in the UK and the deployment of a panEuropean fibre optic network with pointsofpresence in European cities Convergent Networks Convergent Networks is a leading provider of broadband voice infrastructure solutions that enable emerging and incumbent carriers to economically deliv er innovative voice and data services to their business and residential customers The companys Cohesion product family is comprised of three primary element s the ICS broadband switch the ICServiceWorkstm service Corporation Nasda q BRCM the leading provider of integrated circuits enabling broadband communications today reported financial results for the first fiscal quart er ended March Gross revenue for the first quarter was million an increase of over the million reported in the first quarter of and a decrease of from the million reported in the fourth quarter of Net revenue for the first quarter was million an increase of over the million reported in the first quarter of and a decrease of from the million reported in the fourth quarter of Net revenue includes the noncash revenue deduction of the fair value of assumed performancebased warrants earned by certain customers Pro forma net income was million or per share diluted This compares with pro forma net income of million or per share diluted for the same quarter in and pro forma net income of million or per share diluted in the fourth quarter of Dilute d earnings per share for the quarter were based on million weighted average shares outstanding compared to million weighted average shares outstanding in the first quarter of and to million weighted aver age shares outstanding in the fourth quarter of Broadcom reports net income and diluted earnings per share on a pro forma basis which excludes the effects of the noncash revenue deduction related to performancebased warrants acquisitionrelated expenses certain nonrecurring settlement charges and payroll taxes on certain stock option exercises Including these charges substantially all of which were noncash net loss for the first quarter was million or per share compared with net income of million or per share diluted in the same quarter o f and with a net loss of million or per share in the fou rth quarter of During the quarter Broadcom announced and closed its acquisition of ServerWorks Corporation a leading supplier of high performance SystemIOTM solutions for server and storage platforms network appliances and workstations Broadcom also completed the acquisition of Visiontech Ltd a leading supplier of digital videoaudio MPEG compression and decompression chips enabling Personal Vi deo Recording PVR and IP video streaming for the consumer electronics market These acquisitions were accounted for under the purchase method of accounti ng Our first quarter results met the revised expectations that we communicate d on March th Looking ahead as a result of the continued weakness in the communications sector we have not yet seen improvement in order visibility from customers said Dr Henry T Nicholas III Broadcoms President and CEO Despite the current weakness that exists in the business we continue to b e confident that our product roadmaps in both the core and emerging markets w ill position us well as the economy recovers During the first quarter Broadcom introduced several significant new products The company announced the worlds first micron CMOS Gigabit Copper Transceiver a four channel device on a single monolithic chip This produc t enables costeffective high port count Gigabit Ethernet switches and route rs by doubling port density and reducing size and power requirements by This industry leading product marks the fourth generation of Gigabit transceiver products from Broadcom Broadcoms new products for optical communications applications included th e worlds first systemonachip OC line card the worlds first singlech ip OC CMOS transceiver a low power and low cost OC framer and the worlds lowest power Gigabit CMOS limiting amplifier These product introduction s position Broadcom very well in the market for broadband optical communications Broadcoms newly acquired ServerWorks business made two noteworthy announcements during the first quarter First ServerWorks unveiled its new Grand ChampionTM architecture for future IntelR XeonTM based servers This product is th e first to support PCIX the new high performance inputoutput standard for server and workstation platforms and the first to deliver memory bandwidth of Gbytessecond or four times the companys previous solutions In additi on ServerWorks announced new SystemIO logic that is optimized for dense Inter net network servers produced by OEM customers such as Compaq Dell IBM NEC an d Siemens During the quarter the Home Networking Business Unit extended its industry leading position by surpassing the two million unit milestone for total num ber of units shipped HomePNATM which utilizes the phone lines already in a home continues to be the most widely produced home networking technology Broadcom also announced sampled gained design wins and has begun shipping the worlds first singlechip IP phone solution incorporating Ethernet switch technology dual Ethernet transceivers DSP and RISC processor cores and analog CODECs for handset and speakerphone support This highly integrated Etherne t IP phone chip enables tollquality IP phones with the lowest power consumption Broadcom also introduced the first allCMOS BluetoothTM radio to achieve Bluetooth qualification This radio is designed specifically for use in mob ile phone handsets and further extends Broadcoms BlutoniumTM line of Bluetoo th solutions Broadcoms tuner chip was the first to receive CableLabsTM certification and EuroDOCSIS certification This will continue to allow manufacturers to utilize a highly integrated CMOS tuner chip to replace the plus discrete componen ts housed in a tuner can to achieve greater reliability while meeting industry standards Broadcom will conduct a conference call with analysts and investors to disc uss its first quarter financial results and current financial prospects to day at pm Eastern Time pm Pacific Time The company will broadc ast the conference over the Internet To listen to the call please visit the Investor Information section of the Broadcom Website at wwwbroadcomcominvestor or go to wwwstreetfusioncom The Webcast will b e recorded and available for replay until pm Pacific Time on April About Broadcom Broadcom Corporation is the leading provider of highly integrated silicon solutions that enable broadband communications and networking of voice vid eo and data services information click aaspIDDaa AOL USERS copy paste the link above into your browser DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD Precision Dynamics Smart BandTM RFID Wristbands Use TagitTM Smart Label Inlays from Texas Instruments SAN FERNANDO Calif and DALLAS Dec PRNewswire via COMTEX Precision Dynamics Corporation an international leader in identification products announced a new line of identification wristbands Smart BandTM that incorporates TagitTM smart label inlays from Texas Instruments Radi o Frequency Identification RFID Systems Using TIs RFID smart label technology Smart Band provides advanced data storage and a more accurate and secure method of identifying and tracking hospital patients prison inmates and patrons at entertainment and recreation facilities Tagit smart label inlays are an easytointegrate costeffective and consumable RFID solution Consisting of an integrated circuit an antenna a nd requiring no batteries Tagit RFID inlays are paperthin flexible and programmable The programmable feature of Tagit allows applicationspecifi c information to be written to and retrieved from the tags at any time In addition to providing a unique identification number Precision Dynamics Sm art Band can contain data on the location of hospital patients or prison inmate s These could also hold information on the status of an inmates commissary account or automatically debit a patrons account each time a purchase is m ade at a theme park vacation resort or other attraction Information on the RF ID Smart Band can be changed or locked to protect it from being modified Smart Band can be read by handheld RFID scanners or by fixedposition read ers installed in an entryway or other access point in the facility The technol ogy allows users to seamlessly transfer information from its computer systems t o the Smart Band or vice versa potentially eliminating human transcription erro rs The Smart Band can also be positively linked to digital photographs in a database to help ensure more accurate processing of patients inmates and patrons Smart wristbands using TIs RFID technology are a more accurate and secu re method of identification that will improve business operations in numerous environments said Jim Bensman Market Development Manager of Precision Dynamics Precision Dynamics Corporation has developed three Smart Band solutions designed for specific markets that use TIs Tagit smart label technology Sentry Smart Band Clincher Smart Band and Visa Smart Band The Smart Band family of products combine RFID and bar coding technology making them compatible w ith existing computer systems The SentryR Smart BandTM HospitalsHealthcare Facilities Upon admission an RFID smart label containing the patients data is printed on demand and applied to the Sentry Smart Band Benefits include Allows patients to be accurately identified without being moved or touched Creates a permanent record which can be updated at any time Instantly tracks a patients location anywhere in the facility Reduces erroneous procedures and medication The ClincherR Smart BandTM Law EnforcementCorrections The Clincher Smart Band can be used by police departments and correctional facilities to properly identify and process inmates Upon arrest each inmate is assigned a Clincher Smart Band which contains a unique ID number and can also accommodate his or her photo Benefits include Handsfree identification and tracking of inmates throughout the facility Facilitates electronic roll calls and location of patients on demand Instant verification through a link to database of inmate photos discourages wristband tampering and prevents erroneous releases Can be configured to debit inmates commissary accounts each time a purchase is made The VisaR Smart BandTM RecreationEntertainment The Visa Smart Band can be used by the recreational and entertainment industry for access control at concerts sporting events or amusement parks Upon entering a facility each patron is given a Visa Smart Band with an RFID chip that is detected each time the individual passes through one of the portals located in key locations throughout the facility Benefits include Tracks the location of patrons as they pass electronic gateways Electronically controls patrons access to specific attractions Debits patrons account each time a purchase is made Prevents fraud and unauthorized use of wristbands by linking photos and patrons accounts Researches patrons traffic patterns and activities costeffectively For more information on the Smart Band family of products contact Precisio n Dynamics Corporation at or view their web site at wwwpdcorpc om For more information contact TI RFID Systems at or view th eir web site at wwwtiriscom Established in Precision Dynamics Corporation is an international lea der in identification for the healthcare recreationentertainment and correctional industries Located in San Fernando California Precision Dynamics provide s quality innovative identification products using RFID bar coding and ther mal technology Texas Instruments Incorporated is the world leader in digital signal processing and analog technologies the semiconductor engines of the Internet age The companys businesses also include sensors and controls and educational and productivity solutions TI is headquartered in Dallas Texas and has manufacturing or sales operations in more than countries Texas Instrume nts is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TXN NYSE TXN More information is located on the World Wide Web at wwwticom Texas Instruments Radio Frequency Identification RFID Systems is a leadin g developer and manufacturer of fieldproven RFID solutions used in a broad range of applications worldwide TI became the first multinational semiconductor company to market RFID Systems with the introduction of TIRIS Texas Instruments Registration and Identification System in For mor e information call or visit the TI RFID Web site at wwwtiriscom SOURCE Texas Instruments CONTACT Susy dHont of Texas Instruments or Trish Ostroski of Precision Dynamics Corp ext URL C PR Newswire All rights reserved the process to produce and deliver branded Webcasts over th e Internet or corporate intranets The robust production engine can rapidly deliver a custom Webcast that includes the following An embedded video window Synchronized data window Embedded browser and All of the interactive tools that are currently offered through Yahoo Broadcast New features that Yahoo Webcast Studio builds into the broadcast include Automatic detection of the endusers media player Automatic detection of the endusers optimal bandwidth and Automatic slide synchronization feature allowing the archive of the live event to be available as soon as the live event has ended Mass customization of Webcast production and delivery is now upon us sai d Stan Woodward vice president of Business Services for Yahoo With President of EngineeringFDSeasoned Tele com Executive Frank Liang Joins Top Management Team FREMONT Calif Dec PRNewswire via COMTEX WaveSplitter Technologies Inc a worldwide supplier of fiberoptic components for opti cal amplifier and DWDM systems today announced the appointment of Frank Liang as Vice President of Engineering to champion WaveSplitters fusedfiber produc t development efforts With over fifteen years of experience in the fiber optics industry Frank Liang has an extensive background in developing and manufacturing fiberoptic components instrumentation and manufacturing automation Prior to joining WaveSplitter Liang was a Senior Director of Photonic Technologies at ETek DynamicsJDS Uniphase where he led the engineering department in product development of fiberoptic components and integrated modules yield improvements and manufacturing automation As one of the earliest employee s at ETek he was a key contributor in building infrastructure and ramping prod uct development and processes as the company grew His professional accomplishments include designing developing and buildin g the worlds first fiberoptic coupler production workstation for a highyield massproduction environment developing scalable semiconductor laser diode life test systems for pump laser testing and creating manufacturing automation systems for collimatorsDWDM filters He also led engineering teams to deve lop several new fiberoptic components and custom modules such as interleavers AWGs and integrated modules His accomplished career also includes being awarded several patents in manufacturing automation and tunable laser sources As V ice President of Engineering at WaveSplitter Frank will spearhead initiatives to develop new fusedfiber devices enhance manufacturability for volume production and boost productivity improvements We are extremely pleased to have such a seasoned industry professional joi n the WaveSplitter executive team said Bill Diamond President and CEO of WaveSplitter Frank has an extraordinary track record in championing desig n and engineering initiatives in fiber optics and will direct efforts to enhance our fused fiber product portfolio to address the needs of our growing customer base About WaveSplitter Technologies Inc WaveSplitter Technologies Inc develops manufactures and markets reliable highly scalable costeffective components for optical amplifier and DWDM systems for both longhaul and metropolitan area network applications WaveSplitters highperformance fiber and planar lightwave circuit componen ts increase network bandwidth Internet Life for Third Year in a Row SAN FRANCISCO Dec BUSINESS WIRE SeniorNet the premier Web s ite for seniors today announced that Yahoo Internet Life magazine has named i t one of the Best Sites for and the Best Senior Community The January issue of Yahoo Internet Life on sale December honors the top Internet sites that demonstrate outstanding performance and potential in their areas of expertise The honor marks the third consecutive year that SeniorNet has received the Best Sites award from Yahoo Internet Life a monthly consumer lifestyle magazi ne that covers the Internet SeniorNet teaches older adults to use computers a nd the Internet through its nationwide network of more than Learning Cente rs and enriches the lives of millions more through its awardwinning Web site at It also can be found on America Online keyword SeniorNet We chose SeniorNet because we liked the way the offline community the people who go to the organizations nationwide network of Learning Centers embr ace the online community said Cree McCree Senior Editor Yahoo Internet Lif e We also liked the way the people who meet online through the book group s for example go and meet at restaurants There was a good flow between online and offline communities and no other site could claim that SeniorNet also was chosen for its enormous potential With its give and ta ke between online and offline resources added McCree we believe SeniorNet represents the best of the Net as it unfolds in the coming year A panel of more than a dozen Yahoo Internet Life senior editors and staff members monitored the performance and potential of Web sites in their areas of expertise To arrive at the Best sites the editors subjected nominees to rigorous analysis The award recognizes both SeniorNets leadership in the seniors category and its continued support for the Web as a way to exchange knowledge help seni ors learn about new technologies and open the door for seniors to share their wisdom with the world SeniorNet is very honored by this award for our online community and education efforts which include technology training but extend far beyond it to such things as collaborative lifelong learning and crossgenerational communication said Ann Wrixon chief executive officer SeniorNet Were especially hono red that Yahoo Internet Life recognized our accomplishments in bringing the online and offline worlds together Its a concept that has guided us for years and were delighted to see it validated in such a prestigious forum About SeniorNet SeniorNet is based on the belief that computer literacy not only gives older adults access to a world of information and people but also allows them to share their knowledge and wisdom with the world at large Based in San Francisco and founded in SeniorNet is now a ma jor international nonprofit organization that teaches older adults to use computers and the Internet SeniorNet has trained more than people at its nationwide Learning Centers and enriches the lives of millions more throug h its awardwinning Web site With a thriving online community and a nationwide network of more than Learning Centers staffed by more than volunteers SeniorNet provides an onlineoffline bricks and clicks destination to a segment of the population too often neglected in the Information Revolution With sponsorship by major corporations and foundations private and public donations and a backbone of individual members and contributors SeniorNet continues to grow and offer new opportunities to those touched by its missi on About Yahoo Internet Life Yahoo Internet Life wwwyilcom the worlds largest consumer lifestyle magazine covering the Internet is a monthly publication of Ziff Davis Medi a With its mission to entertain engage educate and empower Internet enthusiasts Yahoo Internet Life serves the New American ConsumerTM Reaching one in nine of all daily Internet users in America and read monthly by over million people Yahoo Internet Life chronicles the culture content and community of the Internet In January the four yearold magazine will surpass a circulation of million copies per month solidifying its place as one o f the automation Prior to joining WaveSplitter Liang was a Senior Director of Photonic Technologies at ETek DynamicsJDS Uniphase where he led the engineering department in product development of fiberoptic components and integrated modules yield improvements and manufacturing automation As one of the earliest employee s at ETek he was a key contributor in building infrastructure and ramping prod uct engineering teams to deve lop several new fiberoptic components and custom modules such as interleavers AWGs and integrated modules His accomplished career also includes being awarded several patents tools that Yahoo provid es for thousands of companies each year through Yahoo Broadcasts streaming services Yahoo Webcast Studio enhances Yahoos turnkey Internet broadcasting servi ces by streamlining the process to produce and deliver branded Webcasts over th e Internet or corporate intranets The robust production engine can rapidly deliver a custom Webcast that includes the following An embedded video window Synchronized data window Embedded browser and All of the interactive tools that are currently offered through Yahoo Broadcast New features that Yahoo Webcast Studio builds into the broadcast include Automatic detection of the endusers media player Automatic detection of the endusers optimal bandwidth and Automatic slide synchronization feature allowing the archive of the live event to be available as soon as the live event has ended Mass customization of Webcast production and delivery is now upon us sai d Stan Woodward vice president of Business Services for Yahoo With information click aaspIDDaa AOL USERS copy paste the link above into your browser DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD Precision Dynamics Smart BandTM RFID Wristbands Use TagitTM Smart Label Inlays from Texas Instruments SAN FERNANDO Calif and DALLAS Dec PRNewswire via COMTEX Precision Dynamics Corporation an international leader in identification products announced a new line of identification wristbands Smart BandTM that incorporates TagitTM smart label inlays from Texas Instruments Radi o Frequency Identification RFID Systems Using TIs RFID smart label technology Smart Band provides advanced data storage and a more accurate and secure method of identifying and tracking hospital patients prison inmates and patrons at entertainment and recreation facilities Tagit smart label inlays are an easytointegrate costeffective and consumable RFID solution Consisting of an integrated circuit an antenna a nd requiring no batteries Tagit RFID inlays are paperthin flexible and programmable The programmable feature of Tagit allows applicationspecifi c information to be written to and retrieved from the tags at any time In addition to providing a unique identification number Precision Dynamics Sm art Band can contain data on the location of hospital patients or prison inmate s These could also hold information on the status of an inmates commissary account or automatically debit a patrons account each time a purchase is m ade at a theme park vacation resort or other attraction Information on the RF ID Smart Band can be changed or locked to protect it from being modified Smart Band can be read by handheld RFID scanners or by fixedposition read ers installed in an entryway or other access point in the facility The technol ogy allows users to seamlessly transfer information from its computer systems t o the Smart Band or vice versa potentially eliminating human transcription erro rs The Smart Band can also be positively linked to digital photographs in a database to help ensure more accurate processing of patients inmates and patrons Smart wristbands using TIs RFID technology are a more accurate and secu re method of identification that will improve business operations in numerous environments said Jim Bensman Market Development Manager of Precision Dynamics Precision Dynamics Corporation has developed three Smart Band solutions designed for specific markets that use TIs Tagit smart label technology Sentry Smart Band Clincher Smart Band and Visa Smart Band The Smart Band family of products combine RFID and bar coding technology making them compatible w ith existing computer systems The SentryR Smart BandTM HospitalsHealthcare Facilities Upon admission an RFID smart label containing the patients data is printed on demand and applied to the Sentry Smart Band Benefits include Allows patients to be accurately identified without being moved or touched Creates a permanent record which can be updated at any time Instantly tracks a patients location anywhere in the facility Reduces erroneous procedures and medication The ClincherR Smart BandTM Law EnforcementCorrections The Clincher Smart Band can be used by police departments and correctional facilities to properly identify and process inmates Upon arrest each inmate is assigned a Clincher Smart Band which contains a unique ID number and can also accommodate his or her photo Benefits include Handsfree identification and tracking of inmates throughout the facility Facilitates electronic roll calls and location of patients on demand Instant verification through a link to database of inmate photos discourages wristband tampering and prevents erroneous releases Can be configured to debit inmates commissary accounts each time a purchase is made The VisaR Smart BandTM RecreationEntertainment The Visa Smart Band can be used by the recreational and entertainment industry for access control at concerts sporting events or amusement parks Upon entering a facility each patron is given a Visa Smart Band with an RFID chip that is detected each time the individual passes through one of the portals located in key locations throughout the facility Benefits include Tracks the location of patrons as they pass electronic gateways Electronically controls patrons access to specific attractions Debits patrons account each time a purchase is made Prevents fraud and unauthorized use of wristbands by linking photos and patrons accounts Researches patrons traffic patterns and activities costeffectively For more information on the Smart Band family of products contact Precisio n Dynamics Corporation at or view their web site at wwwpdcorpc om For more information contact TI RFID Systems at or view th eir web site at wwwtiriscom Established in Precision Dynamics Corporation is an international lea der in identification for the healthcare recreationentertainment and correctional industries Located in San Fernando California Precision Dynamics provide s quality innovative identification products using RFID bar coding and ther mal technology Texas Instruments Incorporated is the world leader in digital signal processing and analog technologies the semiconductor engines of the Internet age The companys businesses also include sensors and controls and educational and productivity solutions TI is headquartered in Dallas Texas and has manufacturing or sales operations in more than countries Texas Instrume nts is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TXN NYSE TXN More information is located on the World Wide Web at wwwticom Texas Instruments Radio Frequency Identification RFID Systems is a leadin g developer and manufacturer of fieldproven RFID solutions used in a broad range of applications worldwide TI became the first multinational semiconductor company to market RFID Systems with the introduction of TIRIS Texas Instruments Registration and Identification System in For mor e information call or Supp ort Move to Standardsbased Deployment Models RICHARDSON Texas Dec BUSINESS WIRE OpenVoBtm today announ ced that prominent telecommunications technology leaders have signed on as memb ers of OpenVoB effectively doubling membership of the open industry engineerin g organization formed to accelerate the deployment of interoperable voice ove r broadband technologies products and services The new members of OpenVoB join the ongoing efforts of a broadbased group of leading telecom cable and wireless broadband network developers to elimina te obstacles standing in the way of validated VoB solutions The organization is working to ensure uninhibited growth in the deployment of voice over broadb and networks through the cooperative development of proven multivendor architectural options and interoperable platforms for implementing industry standard VoB technologies The first of these implementations and test plan models the D GRA AL BLES model for VoDSL systems based on the ATM Forum AAL Loop Emulation Service was tested at the groups inaugural OpenVoB CallFesttm held the week o f Nov Dec at the University of New Hampshire InterOperability Laboratory in Durham NH This first CallFest was a controlled working engineeronly event structured to create a secure cooperative test environment in which senior product development and test engineers are free to address critical interoperability issues between products and platforms being readi ed for deployment About OpenVoB OpenVoB was formed to meet the expressed needs of service providers plannin g to deploy voice over broadband services OpenVoB is committed to developing deployment models for voice over broadband utilizing established and emergi ng guidelines supported by the worlds leading industry standards bodies The special interest group is not seeking to develop new standards or modify existing standards nor does it promote the specific technologies products or services of any individual company or vendorspecific alliance All vendors customers industry associations and others partners and competitors alik e seeking to contribute to the acceleration of voice over broadband are encouraged to join OpenVoB and participate fully in all activities Members of OpenVoB have drafted a white paper that outlines the pressing ne ed for this organization and presents a road map detailing the steps the group intends to take to reach its primary objectives The white paper can be fou nd on the OpenVoB Web site which also hosts a wealth of information about the OpenVoB organization FAQs online Corporation Nasda q BRCM the leading provider of integrated circuits enabling broadband communications today reported financial results for the first fiscal quart er ended March Gross revenue for the first quarter was million an increase of over the million reported in the first quarter of and a decrease of from the million reported in the fourth quarter of Net revenue for the first quarter was million an increase of over the million reported in the first quarter of and a decrease of from the million reported in the fourth quarter of Net revenue includes the noncash revenue deduction of the fair value of assumed performancebased warrants earned by certain customers Pro forma net income was million or per share diluted This compares with pro forma net income of million or per share diluted for the same quarter in and pro forma net income of million or per share diluted in the fourth quarter of Dilute d earnings per share for the quarter were based on million weighted average shares outstanding compared to million weighted average shares outstanding in the first quarter of and to million weighted aver age shares outstanding in the fourth quarter of Broadcom reports net income and diluted earnings per share on a pro forma basis which excludes the effects of the noncash revenue deduction related to performancebased warrants acquisitionrelated expenses certain nonrecurring settlement charges and payroll taxes on certain stock option exercises Including these charges substantially all of which were noncash net loss for the first quarter was million or per share compared with net income of million or per share diluted in the same quarter o f and with a net loss of million or per share in the fou rth quarter of During the quarter Broadcom announced and closed its acquisition of ServerWorks Corporation a leading supplier of high performance SystemIOTM solutions for server and storage platforms network appliances and workstations Broadcom also completed the acquisition of Visiontech Ltd a leading supplier of digital videoaudio MPEG compression and decompression chips enabling Personal Vi deo Recording PVR and IP video streaming for the consumer electronics market These acquisitions were accounted for under the purchase method of accounti ng Our first quarter results met the revised expectations that we communicate d on March th Looking ahead as a result of the continued weakness in the communications sector we have not yet seen improvement in order visibility from customers said Dr Henry T Nicholas III Broadcoms President and CEO Despite the current weakness that exists in the business we continue to b e confident that our product roadmaps in both the core and emerging markets w ill position us well as the economy recovers During the first quarter Broadcom introduced several significant new products The company announced the worlds first micron CMOS Gigabit Copper Transceiver a four channel device on a single monolithic chip This produc t enables costeffective high port count Gigabit Ethernet switches and route rs by doubling port density and reducing size and power requirements by This industry leading product marks the fourth generation of Gigabit transceiver products from Broadcom Broadcoms new products for optical communications applications included th e worlds first systemonachip OC line card the worlds first singlech ip OC CMOS transceiver a low power and low cost OC framer and the worlds lowest power Gigabit CMOS limiting amplifier These product introduction s position Broadcom very well in the market for broadband optical communications Broadcoms newly acquired ServerWorks business made two noteworthy announcements during the first quarter First ServerWorks unveiled its new Grand ChampionTM architecture for future IntelR XeonTM based servers This product is th e first to support PCIX the new high performance inputoutput standard for server and workstation platforms and the first to deliver memory bandwidth of Gbytessecond or four times the companys previous solutions In additi on ServerWorks announced new SystemIO logic that is optimized for dense Inter net network servers produced by OEM customers such as Compaq Dell IBM NEC an d Siemens During the quarter the Home Networking Business Unit extended its industry leading position by surpassing the two million unit milestone for total num ber of units shipped HomePNATM which utilizes the phone lines already in a home continues to be the most widely produced home networking technology Broadcom also announced sampled gained design wins and has begun shipping the worlds first singlechip IP phone solution incorporating Ethernet switch technology dual Ethernet transceivers DSP and RISC processor cores and analog CODECs for handset and speakerphone support This highly integrated Etherne t IP phone chip enables tollquality IP phones with the lowest power consumption Broadcom also introduced the first allCMOS BluetoothTM radio to achieve Bluetooth qualification This radio is designed specifically for use in mob ile phone handsets and further extends Broadcoms BlutoniumTM line of Bluetoo th solutions Broadcoms tuner chip was the first to receive CableLabsTM certification and EuroDOCSIS certification This will continue to allow manufacturers to utilize a highly integrated CMOS tuner chip to replace the plus discrete componen ts housed in a tuner can to achieve greater reliability while meeting industry standards Broadcom will conduct a conference call with analysts and investors to disc uss its first quarter financial results and current financial prospects to day at pm Eastern Time pm Pacific Time The company will broadc ast the conference over the Internet To listen to the call please visit the Investor Information section of the Broadcom Website at wwwbroadcomcominvestor or go to wwwstreetfusioncom The Webcast will b e recorded and available for replay until pm Pacific Time on April About Broadcom Broadcom Corporation is the leading provider of highly integrated silicon solutions that enable broadband communications and networking of voice vid eo and data services Using proprietary technologies and advanced design methodologies Broadcom designs develops and supplies complete systemonachip solutions and related applications for digital cable settop boxes and paste the link above into your browser DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD AMCC First to Enable the Next Generation MultiCarrier Transparent Network Architecture With Introduction of Gbps Digital Wrapper and FEC DeviceFDAMCCs Hudson is the Industrys First Device to Meet the Rapidl y Growing Demand for Gbps Digital Wrapper Solutions From the Man Transport and WD M Sectors SAN DIEGO Dec BUSINESS WIRE Applied Micro Circuits Corp AM CC NasdaqAMCC a leader in highbandwidth silicon connectivity solutions fo r the worlds optical networks today announced the Hudson S the industry s first Gbps silicon device architected to support both the evolving G digital wrapper standard and traditional SONETSDH infrastructures The Hudson variable rate digital wrapper framerdeframer and performance monitor device facilitates the transparent transport of multiple protocols across the network while aiding interconnection between multiple carriers Hudson incorporates programmable Forward Error Correction FEC for rates u p to Gbps and supports OC transmission standards The digital wrapper technology provides an extension of the current SONETSDH infrastructure while enhancing both flexibility and transparency across the network The Hudson easily interfaces with AMCCs Gbps muxdemux devices SONETSDHdigital wrapper backplane devices and AMCCs mapping and pointer processing devices The digital wrapper is the next important step for large optical networks as it incorporates the best features of SONETSDH while removing some of the rigi d overhead structure that makes SONETSDH suboptimal for an IPcentric intelligent optical network said Brent Little vice president of marketin g for AMCC By using key devices such as Hudson OEMs will now be able to create more efficient and interoperable systems without starting from scratch AMCCs digital wrapper design has already been adopted by most of the major wide area networking WAN equipment manufacturers The demand for digital wrapp er products stems from the need in the WAN to transparently transport multiple protocols at Gbps coupled with the need to efficiently provision bandwi dth across todays multiplecarrier network The Hudson is built for the nextgeneration multicarrier transport networ k architecture and ushers in an efficient and costeffective means of transporting traffic while extending existing SONET infrastructures said Ken Prentiss AMCCs director of marketing for telecom products We are seeing unprecedented demand for Hudson across a large customer base due mainly to the devices flexible architecture customers can wrap unwrap or monitor traditional SONETSDH traffic or wrap and unwrap IP or any other traffic using a singl e device The digital wrapper concept involves grouping together a number of existing frames into superframes which can then be more efficiently managed with a relatively small allocation of overheadperbyte of data By aggregating together the provisions for framing bits that are already defined for use by existing timedivision multiplexed TDM structures the superframe concep t allows for the implementation of an intelligent operation administration a nd maintenance OAM capability without materially expanding the amount of dat a currently being transmitted This creative use of available control bits al so allows FEC functions to be very efficiently incorporated within the digital wrapper definition without a significant net increase in overall bandwidth usage The Hudsons core logic runs on a V power supply and features two input and two output ports which are configurable in many ways Figure shows a typical network application supporting a single data stream with dual redundant inp ut and output lines The input and output ports can be configured as a dual redundant IO on a single data stream for protection switching or as two completely independent data streams for duplex operation Either input port can be directly connected to either output port for loopback testing The Hudson provides full digital wrapper performance monitoring and feature s Optical Channel Overhead OChOH insertion and extraction which are independently controllable All OChOH bytes in a superframe are programmable in function and are available for insertion from and drop to FPGA or microprocessor Data entering and leaving the Hudson device can be optional ly differentially decoded and encoded deframed and framed descrambled and scrambled and decoded and encoded with FEC information In addition SONET data can optionally be performance monitored for integrity alarms and trace messages Pricing and Availability The Hudson S packaged in a pin CBGA will be sampling to development partners in December with volume production commencing in Q AMCC solution set pricing can be obtained from the company by calling AMCC About AMCC AMCC designs develops manufactures and markets highperformance highbandwidth silicon solutions for the worlds optical networks AMCC utilizes a combination of highfrequency analog mixedsignal and digital design expertise coupled with systemlevel knowledge and multiple silicon process technologies to offer integrated circuit products that enable the transport of voice and data over fiber optic networks The companys system solution portfolio includes PMD PHY framermapper network processor traffic management and switch fabric devices that address the highperformance need s of the evolving intelligent optical network AMCCs corporate headquarters and wafer fabrication facilities are located in San Diego Sales and engineerin g offices are located throughout the world AMCC Forward Looking Statements The statements contained in this press release that are not purely historic al are REVIEW THE NOTICE AND DISCLAIMER BELOW DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDD Paid Advertisement D DDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD Looking for an emerging growth company in an exciting burgeoning industry Search no more XraymediaCom OTC BB XRMD is currently assembling the partners to undertake the business of selling conventional advertising space and online advertising in an industry that broke the billion dollar mark in the second quarter of For more compelling information on this exciting investment opportunity click here aaspIDDaa AOL USERS copy paste the link above into your browser DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDD Broadcom Unveils Worlds First Gigabit Ethernet Controller with Support for PCIX StandardFDBCM Demonstrates Higher Performance and Lower C PU Utilization Than Any Other Commercially Available Solution IRVINE Calif Dec BUSINESS WIRE Broadcom Corporation NasdaqBRCM the leading provider of integrated circuits enabling broadba nd communications today extended its leadership position in Gigabit Ethernet with the introduction of the worlds first Gigabit Ethernet Media Access Control ler MAC chip that supports Peripheral Computer Interconnect PCI and PCIX local bus interfaces for use in network interface cards NIC and LANonMotherbo ard LOM implementations The companys first Gigabit Ethernet MAC the BroadcomR BCM which co mes with a comprehensive suite of software sets a new standard in the industry for performance and onchip integration Broadcoms high performance BASET MAC is complemented by its broad family of Gigabit Ethernet transcei ver chips and will enable the company to provide customers with complete MACtransceiver solutions that will drive down the cost of Gigabit Ethernet in nextgeneration servers workstations and desktop computers Furthermore Broadcoms strategic alliance announced today with Com Corporation the mo st preferred brand and channel for network interface cards and LOM networking solutions will further accelerate customer migration from Fast Ethernet to Gigabit Ethernet By delivering leading edge MAC transceiver and software technology with unprecedented levels of integration Broadcom is driving up performance whi le driving down the price points to enable widespread adoption of Gigabit Ethernet said Marty Colombatto Vice President and General Manager of Broadcoms Networking Business Unit Broadcoms initiative to develop Giga bit MAC technology is strategic to our overall commitment to deliver to our customers the highest level of integration and performance for the advancem ent of corporate networks Broadcoms first generation Gigabit Ethernet controller provides an unprecedented level of integration combining support for Megab it per second Mbps operation dual highspeed onchip processors KB of integrated onchip memory advanced packet classification engines and PCI PCIX local bus interconnects in a singlechip solution Triple speed and Mbps support with standardbased autonegotiation allows server workstation and desktop computer manufacturers to build solutions that can transparently interface with Ethernet Fast Ethernet and Gigabit Ethernet technology over the existing Category cabling infrastructure and provide s an easy path for migrating legacy Mbps and Mbps networks to Gigabit speed The BCM is the industrys first Gigabit MAC to incorporate the recently approved PCIX v local bus interface specification allowing data transfe r rates of up to Gigabytes per second between the controller and the system Support for PCIX enables Broadcoms Gigabit Ethernet MAC to maintain traff ic at Gigabit speeds in IO intensive server applications where multiple communication and storage peripheral devices share the same IO bus Broadcoms support f or the new PCIX interface demonstrates the companys commitment to delivering leading edge IO technology for servers and workstations According to Bert McComas analyst for InQuest Market research By the mid dle of we expect that PCIX will be enabled in new mainstream server platforms from all leading server vendors PCIX builds on the momentum of PCI as the most widely supported IO standard in the world and defines a clear path to satisfy next generation server IO performance demands Gigabit Ethernet provides ten times the performance of todays BASE T server workstation and desktop network connections This leap forward in performance is especially critical for todays servers and workstations tha t are already being bottlenecked by aging Ethernet connections With Inter net traffic doubling every three to six months accelerating the performance an d communication speed of the server is critical for enhancing endusers Internet and eBusiness experience Early tests show the BCM raises the bar for the competition in both throughput and host CPU efficiency By focusing on total performance of the system the architecture of the BCM enables servers and workstations no t only to communicate faster but also to reduce the consumption of valuable system resources needed to reach Gigabit communications speeds PCIX is an extension of the widely accepted PCI standard for data transfer between CPUs and IO peripherals and is becoming widely used by manufacture rs for speeding the flow of data within servers storage area networks and network switches Backwards compatible with the high performance PCI local bus specification PCIX offers an immediate solution to the increased IO requirements for highbandwidth applications such as Gigabit Ethernet Fibr e Channel Ultra SCSI and highperformance graphics PCIX supports bit a nd bit operations at frequencies up to MHz allowing data throughput of over Gigabyte per second Broadcom also offers the most complete suite of software for server applications supporting all leading operating systems This software suite is already undergoing extensive systemlevel qualification by leading server OEMs Broadcoms server software package includes multivendor failover IEEE AD port aggregation Layer switchindependent SmartLoadBalancingTM HotPlug PCI IEEE Q VLAN tagging and IEEE P traffic prioritization for Quality of Service QoS cable analyzer and advanced diagnostics and cont rol functions The combined BCM MAC and server software solution demonstrat es superior functionality to any other Gigabit Ethernet NIC or LOM solution commercially available today A complete NIC and LOM solution is achieved by combining the BCM with o ne of Broadcoms market leading Gigabit Ethernet transceivers which support the three Ethernet speeds and Mbps in a singlechip solution with intelligent networking functions such as cable diagnostics and auto networ k detection Having shipped over a million Gigabit Ethernet ports Broadcom continues to extend its leadership position in Gigabit Ethernet with the broadest most advanced family of Gigabit Ethernet transceivers Broadcoms Gigabit Ethernet transceiver architecture is the only solution that has bee n proven in actual highvolume field deployment Furthermore Broadcoms Giga bit Ethernet transceiver architecture has completed over eighteen months of extensive system and devicelevel testing in realworld and worsecase cable plants by hundreds of engineers in dozens of test sites worldwide Pricing and Availability Broadcoms Gigabit Ethernet MAC and Phy chipset solution is available now a nd is priced at About Broadcom Broadcom Corporation is the leading provider of highly integrated silicon solutions that enable broadband digital transmission of voice video and data Using proprietary technologies and advanced design methodologies the compa ny designs develops and supplies integrated circuits for a number of the most significant broadband communications markets including the markets for cab le settop boxes cable modems highspeed local metropolitan and wide area networks home networking Voice over Internet Protocol VoIP carrier access residential broadband gateways direct broadcast satellite and terrestrial digital broadcast optical networking digital subscriber lines xDSL and wireless communications Broadcom is headquartered in Irvine Calif and m ay be contacted at or at wwwbroadcomcom Safe Harbor Statement under the distributor relations hip that existed prior to TIs acquisition of Burr Brown Insight has been the leading distributor in the Americas for the TIBurr Brown precision analog products for the past seven years The focus of the new agreement is to give Insight customers that design communications computing audio and video imaging systems greater access t o the most comprehensive selection of high performance analog and mixed signal solutions Insight will also provide billofmaterial support for customers with the full TI product offering including TIs digital signal processing DSP product portfolio Insight has a track record of success supporting customers with Burr Brown products said John Simari worldwide director of distribution Texas Instruments We want to leverage Insights strengths across TI especially TIs analog and mixed signal product portfolio to further our growth in this important area The full TI analog product line will be available in the Americas through Insight by January Product stocking and training is expected to be complete by the end of Q In the interim Insight will continue to represent the TIBurr Brown precision analog products The customer solution focus shared by Insight and TI makes this a perfect fit said Greg Provenzano president and CEO of Insight Electronics This partnership allows uninterrupted support to our TIBurr Brown customers in addition to an enhanced offering of technology products Insight has always been focused on the technical design community and its needs especially in the analog area said Provenzano Coupling our strengths with TIs initiative to grow its position in precision analog provides grea t synergy and will help designers bring advanced systems to market faster and more efficiently About linecard of leading semiconductor companies Insights sales team and field application engineers are thoroughly knowledgeable about their suppliers products processes and technologies The companys valueadded services combined with its expertise in design inventory management logistics and use of ebusiness tools ensure that customers receive the products they need when and where they need them
